meanings.definition: To shape or form in advance.
meanings.sent1: I will preform the clay before starting the pottery project.
meanings.sent2: She likes to preform the dough into different shapes before baking.
meanings.sent3: The artist decided to preform the sculpture in a funny way, making it look like a cartoon character.
meanings.sent4: The chef's hands seemed to preform magic as he shaped the pasta dough effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: Watching the potter preform the clay was like witnessing a master at work.

meanings.sent1: The company created a preform of the new product to show to investors.
meanings.sent2: The architect used a preform to visualize the building before construction began.
meanings.sent3: The child made a preform of a spaceship using cardboard boxes and paint.
meanings.sent4: The preform of the dress looked stunning on the mannequin, giving a glimpse of the final design.
meanings.sent5: The preform of the building displayed intricate details that amazed everyone who saw it.
